unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: P-value of a 1-sided Test When Given the z-score
question_text:
A significance test was used to test the null hypothesis ${ H }_{ 0 }$: $p =0.34$ versus the alternative ${ H }_{ a }$: $p <0.34$. The resulting test statistic is $z=-0.83$.
The $P$-value for this test is approximately:
